// 1. As a pre-req for this you need to create an account on docker hub. Note the user name and password

// Prepare the shell scripts based on deployconfig.json for each service (system and app)
node prep.js -u phanipc -f ./deployconfig.json -d ./tmp -c -s
// Note -u is the user name for dockerhub account
// -f points to the deployconfig.json path (By customizing this script, you can change the deployment of the application services)
// -d path to the directory where the various deployment scripts get written to
// -c option will cleanup the scripts dir pointed to by -d before running th script. Always recommended.


// This produces three sets of files in the directory pointed to by -d option above (./tmp in this case)
// For preparing docker images ddprep.sh
// For running docker locally dd*.sh, dd.yml 
// For deploying to aws, if the machines are listed in the deployconfig.json
//  ubu.yml, ubusetupmachines_local.sh and ubudeploy.sh
// -----------------------------------------------------------------

// -----------------------------------------------------------------
// For preparing the images
bash ddprep.sh
// This will prompt you to give password for the docker hub account
// -----------------------------------------------------------------

// -----------------------------------------------------------------
// For locally running docker
// initialize swarm
bash ddswinit.sh
// deploy the services defined by dd.yml
bash dddeploy.sh
// -----------------------------------------------------------------

// -----------------------------------------------------------------
// Setup the ubuntu machines with all the prereqs, copy the requisite files etc.
bash ubusetupmachines_local.sh
ssh to each of the machines and run bash ubudeploy.sh 
// -----------------------------------------------------------------
